tweets.author: PlutonicXBT
tweets.text:
In many ways AI is the perfect narrative for an extremely late stage bullish trend

Most discourse has shifted towards cynicism- how incapable & thus disposable human capital is in order to maximize shareholder value w/ decreasing concern about anything beyond how number goes up

tweets.author: PlutonicXBT
tweets.text:
So, was the cynicism displayed by the memecoin supercycle 1+ year ago what we saw at the top of said trend, or before a raging uptrend that believers spoke so confidently in was imminent? 

I am bullish on humanity, and thus I rest my case

tweets.author: PlutonicXBT
tweets.text:
Really witnessing the memecoin supercycle rhetoric all over again, where we assume that the tech scales exponentially along with the cynicism required to support the thesis

But contrary to what social media has you believe, cynicism doesn't scale easily, you're in a bubble

tweets.author: tphuang
tweets.text:
Global supply chain for AI industry has so many choke points. Few ppl consider MLCC, but it's critical.

China has added TDK to its export control list, so no more Rare Earth. Will Murata & Taiyo be next?

Will chipmakers lineup for Chinese suppliers? Can they meet the demand?
